MVDWCp4-xQfH50_uOMzgOA.text: Food is horrible.  They served the food prepared for lunch in dinner.  The staff are very disrespectful and money minded.  I will never visit them again...

C2nXofOfqBJPvzbwqLBbdA.text: Tried this place few times (dinner and lunch buffet). With so many Indian restaurants sprouting up in this area, i am surprised that they feel no need to provide quality food and service. This one is the worst. Their dum biryani is the most sub-standard biryani. Other items i have tried here are no better  Another restaurant to cross out.

GoSRC6-75T3UYr56q5d-rA.text: Big selection of tasty vegetarian foods which were so tasty.  I would say the best Indian buffet.  I rediscovered Southern Indian food.  Yay!  I'm stuffed.

-XkW0uIOxyHtl2HamIdCBA.text: Our go to place to order Veg Dum Biryani. So far we have ordered 5 times and it has been very consistent in taste and spice levels. Hope you guys continue delivering good food and service !!

fAvt8T9YKWMgQiXFJDb-XQ.text: One of the best authentic food. Brings back so many age old recipes of my grandma time. Great going. Large space gives it a resort style buffet looks.   Spice level needs to be customized and start at a low to medium when not asked.

oTttylCAiO8CqmHfvKNLuQ.text: We were so glad we tried this restaurant this past Saturday evening.  The staff was so very friendly as was the owner, Raja. They all took the time to talk to us about the menu and make suggestions.  Raja shared his journey to Charlotte and then to his decision to open this restaurant.  An impressive career to be sure.  The food was excellent...enough to eat well there and bring leftovers home for later.  The menu is vast, the restaurant is large but welcoming.  We usually eat late but got there around 7:30 and it wasn't that crowded, but soon the restaurant was filled with families and individuals, including many many Indians, which is always a good sign that the food is authentic.  We will definately go back.  There is lots to try, and the friendliness of the waitstaff and its owner will make it a pleasure to see them again.  Thanks for the recommendations guy!

sLNmPfVpnvl1nsjal5c-sg.text: Ordered pick up food few days back. Extreme experiences. Pick up was smooth and had to wait for few minutes. Kurnool chicken gravy was top notch, and spicy as expected. Gongura chicken gravy was above average and could be better. Complementary rice quantity and quality could improve. The worst was the chicken tandoori. It is not easy to cook good tandoori and so we generally avoid it at most places; however, considering it was an andhra based indian restaurant, we took chance and failed again. I will give few more chances to the place to have few favourites and reorder them in future.

kbUXidLiS4YUgtIdMv-1WA.text: Had ala carte last week for dinner, was good. Called to order Togo on Sat for lunch, they said I can come in & take Togo from buffet. I go there and the guy at the host stand, tells me to wait for 2 mins and no one to attend for 20 mins. It hardly takes a minute or two to help with a Togo box and then me to make selections. Very bad customer service, at least be courteous. Maybe you can get basic respect if I speak Telugu...P would give -ve 100 stars if yelp allows. Pissed off with the treatment.

w2WjZMkIWsT_pXZ-Kl-HXw.text: Worst food... Waste of money.. jus spicy raw masala and not cooked well too.... appetizers are horrible..

DA1NH_-p-JIBmHlqIIn80w.text: Being Indian food lovers and seeing this new restaurant in our area, my husband and I went here recently and tried a masala dosa. The flavor was good, but the dosa was so crispy that it fell apart/crumbled like a cracker when we tried to rip a piece off (usually it should hold together and be a little chewy) and there was only a small amount of masala potatoes inside. We really enjoyed the tomato chutney that came with the dosa. The dal soup was good, but really spicy! We did not try anything else on the menu. Overall, we thought the food was ok and service mediocre, but will likely not go back.

kA4rT2FMnXwZkHjHOQfiIQ.text: Went for the weekend buffet..Good food , great service and atmosphere. The weekend buffet is a bit expensive.

n3FCg1OJP4FP_s7RIT_mSw.text: We went in for lunch buffet and dinner for a few times. The food was really delicious, very unlike other Indian restaurants. The buffet was awesome, the owner changes the buffet menu every now and then. The biryani was cooked to perfection, probably the best in Charlotte. They serve authentic Indian food which tastes better than the fine dining ones offered in Charlotte. There is a little hitch with the service, but I understand that can be improved as they have just opened. If you would like to have authentic delicious Indian food, this is the place to go to.

Tv-Vyfew3IXGZ04aHcv2DA.text: As a non-Indian, I thought the lunch buffet at this place was impressive. It's some of the spiciest Indian food I've ever had, but the milkshake and curd rice help dull the heat. I'm glad to have another excellent Indian option in the area, along with Peacock, Tulips, etc. When I was there, almost the entire clientele appeared to be Indian, but I would recommend this place to non-Indians who want to expand their knowledge of Indian food.

h6b52xyq8JOlUw0PBvqycA.text: Starters option was less. We got choices of Mysore bonda and aloo bonda. sambhar and rasam were available as expected with rice and potato fry combination . I am surprised they had dhum biriyani and veg noodles. Masala chai was good.

kByfCQWxLhyZh1KJdSEeng.text: Never order the below combo....They are made with same sauce & tastes same... such a pathetic food we ever tasted...   Chicken Manchuria Chicken lollipop/drumsticks & Andhra kodi biriyani (they serve dum biriyani rice with Chicken Manchuria)

PCVEFArtc2VhFcPAGvm5Zg.text: The food is good--not great. I ate the lunch buffet, and it was limited. They ran out of naan and didn't have onion chutney. The big problem is that the place is dirty. The windows are pretty gross with cobwebs in the corner; the front door was covered in hand prints. Also, the outside is overgrown with weeds and not kept up. I won't return without an overhaul.

NxyZgdlvQ0ae99AdLgzpRQ.text: After trying out dinner at other Indian places, was here for a lunch buffet on the day of Christmas and yippeee, loved all the items here. Food was perfectly done, nothing too mild nor too spicy. If you are looking for a good Indian food buffet in Charlotte area, this is the place.

9a2jm5PRnNbiozuhfvlAoA.text: One of the finest India restaurant in Charlotte!!  Authentic Indian food, South Indian flavors and keeping justice with North Indian entrees, good veg and non veg options  Lunch buffet is very good

XObilzO_Udulp3l-K9BXqw.text: The food wasn't fresh. I ordered idly-wada and pakora for take away. The pakoras literally tasted as if they were made during the afternoon buffet and were simply reheated and given to us. Sambar was wattery. Idlis tasted stale.

SvJbMVGTfMzhVKxRENvcag.text: Pathetic.poor service and terrible food.they served stale potato masala in the masala dosa we ordered and the funniest part is when we said it was stale they outrightly denied- verbatim- chef tasted and said it was fresh.I must say I never had disgusting experience like this in any of the restaurants in Charlotte.not recommended

1Ce8sg25VMeXQjeQeSM7NA.text: Yum!!! Moved here from central jersey and looking for favorites...and found it here!! Delicious cauliflower appetizer--with a yogurt sauce.  Goat entree and Chicken tikka Marsala both delicious.  Came Home with extra nan to enjoy our leftovers.  I'll be back!  Thank you.

A1WS7zeHFFNDnfLzVtY5Ew.text: Boneless Biyarni Chicken rice plate from postmates. Delicious and flavorful!! Asked for spicy and they delivered! I don't care about the other reviews because I ordered it delivered through postmates and I highly recommend it if you don't want to deal with average service. Can't speak for it besides that they forgot my fork. Oh well!! By the way I eat Indian food regularly as I am from San Francisco, CA. Hands down it's very authentic and delicious

IointcsGUOzrRg9VORNjFQ.text: I have been here three times for their lunch buffet. During the weekdays, the selections are good. On the weekends, the selections are great. Even have someone there to make fresh Dosa. Flavors on most dishes are great. Just know some dishes are spicy from mod to low high. Desserts are my favorite. They also have mango lassi and Indian coffee offer with the buffet. This is the best Indian buffet in town, just know that some dishes are spicy. If you go near the time the buffet is over, selection may be sparse.

SBWTh-khwgrbODrkgPjmfw.text: 1. Chicken fry -- undercooked , can see blood inside and full of oil 2.mutton biryani : i dont see single piece of mutton. 3. Dosa plate : empty 4. Fish fry plate : empty 5. Beetroot halwa : good

EhnUbY2to6dRZ__D_wM25g.text: Meh...Food was ok but service was awful. Had to ask for everything (water, specials) and they were serving everyone else first with no explanation. We also ordered chicken wings for kids (no spice) which came out with spice after 45min. of waiting. Probably won't be going back

0IPK2vYx512D_6EsOLVYVg.text: Food is certainly delicious!  However, they are very very slow to refill the entrees in the buffet even before 1:00pm!  Plus I feel that a weekly price of $13.99 is too high.  Not sure if I want to go back to the restaurant because I felt that I could not return to the buffet to get more of the food I enjoyed.  I left feeling disappointed.  Sorry Godavari- great food but poor service.

rMNo4FHJd05aE8ehgFt1oA.text: So I called for a to go order and took 2 samosas chaat and it was so delicious even after I ate 2 hours just loved it . I asked for a Pav baji but they dint have that . And the owner was quickly attentive and gave us our food .

sIuj5L1ws6wAEY5V0UEBug.text: I tried buffet, Food was just ok, too much oil and too much red chili in all the dishes. tables were not clean. Couldn't find bowls for soup & deserts, had to use steel glass for that. Restaurant is big but maintenance was poor. All the waiters are super busy and no one listens to you, so if you want to ask for anything then better forget to ask.

GfobXHJSjaqjq0IkHBYESA.text: Best Buffet I had in my 5 years in the US. They make traditional south-Indian food, very tasty, spicy and flavorful. Must try if you like spicy food and if you are in Charlotte. Recently they opened up in Columbus, Ohio so seems like they are spreading. Only con is, while we visited Godavari on a Saturday afternoon for buffet and it was crowded, and the manager/owner couldn't keep up with the billing and it was a wait for 15 mins just to play the bill. Other than that the food is awesome !!

hakxs5xUXg1WjdggcI31WA.text: I'm really impressed with the food and ambiance at Godavari. Staff was courteous and promptly seated us upon arrival. I must admit that I have never been to an Indian restaurant in the United States with such a huge buffet  menu. Absolutely loved it!  Highly recommend it.

bA1xvqljdswr43jvaqFN_Q.text: Best andhra food.. This is definitely one of the good Indian restaurants you can find in Charlotte area. Their weekend buffet is good. Quality and service is good. I hope they maintain the quality and service.

-L4LsRg4pg4UIRVN-5RECg.text: Well the goat was good, the red chicken was good.  The rice was hardly palatable even after putting heavy gravy from the above dishes on them  the squash was good, the round sweet balls were way overly sweet.  The buffet was not very appetizing to look at, everything was very spicey and would not recommend for the kids, very spicy. The food was palatable at best.  Very dissatisfied with the overall experience and would not recommend.  Water was the only option offered for drinking.  The yogurt used to cut the spiciness of the food was good.

SkqxfOAZxjob7nb1BiSSXw.text: Menu is grossly misleading. More than half of the items listed in menu aren't available most of the times. The so called special biriyani seems to be too special. It is never available. Even simplest snack items are not available most of the times. There's no point looking at the menu online or at the restaurant to order. I'd rather have people saying what's available like in the old times.

rNQSMNzGhBWpIKxeV6kTWQ.text: Went to eat here and it was just ok. Thee was no flavor to it. Service was super slow even though we were one of 3 tables.

ap0ezXrVvMbHZ4TU2k5EPw.text: **Pathetic service and bland food**  The worst indian restaurant i been in the US yet. My friend ordered a Sweet Lassi and they served Salt Lassi.   We had to call the server everytime we need something. Always unattended by them. Even though it was not a busy night and there were more than 3 servers working.   We got chicken pieces in an egg biryani. If you are a vegeterian think twice before you eat here. The food was def not fresh and was flavourless.   Never going back. And do not suggest anyone to try this place out.

inofTwEIOeV6zKS6vMQMRQ.text: Enjoyed the food very much! Went on a Saturday evening after visiting the local ikea. We wanted something that we couldn't get locally in our small town. Upon arrival we where seated immediately. We ordered samosas, butter naan, chicken tika masala, tandoori chicken and a Marsala chai tea... everything was delicious, served hot and fresh! Authentic, medium spicy wasn't to much for this light weight. Servers where very attentive and friendly. Would def go back when in the area!

2KqZnbbKivX5sSOU2M8Jtw.text: I give this place only two stars. The food is not bad, except that it's too flavourful. So unless you are really used to the strong flavours, you may not enjoy the food a lot.   Now coming to the ambience part of the restaruant, I think this is one of the worst places. Looks very unhygenic and even the waiter and waitress here don't know how to attend to the customers. They constantly drop the silverware and I've noticed that they don't sanitize the cutlery and plates properly, which leads to a big hygiene issue. I would not recommend this place to anyone! Ever!

eA0i651s6ofYvjZkmw65wg.text: Went in for lunch buffet but this day they did not have.  Ordered off menu and food was pretty good.  Tandoori chicken could have been marinated a little longer the spices didn't get into the meat... still good but not what I'm used to.  Lamb gosh was really good my husband enjoyed it and spice level was perfect for him.  Did notice the low food score on the way out.... 90 too low for me so I will check that before coming back.

eTYFigvUncfKJAwPB9hJIw.text: I had the Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan. The portion size for rice is not great. The Naan doesnt have great flavor. Even though it's just bread, I've had better. If I had to compare this place to where I normally go, Passage to India, I wouldn't return here. The food doesnt really have a fresh taste like I enjoy.

SnFQxajRDSoLgvsTpkVCGw.text: Like Akhila said, people will review it down for the dings in the decor (like chipped paint at booths) but the food is awesome and worth it! Everything was so good - I had a tiny bite of almost everything and I wanted to get more but was just too full. So many offerings and I can't decide what I would have gotten seconds of - each taste was delicious. From reviews it seems they may not be consistent or that they recently changed owners but I got there right at opening on Sunday and it was perfect food. It felt a little weird being there before other customers and it was totally quiet as they finished setting out the buffet and served my pitcher of water. but then they turned the Bollywood musicals on the tv and it had plenty of customers, mostly Indian, by the time I left. First to come in were single guys and then families and couples started coming. So the vibe is very casual but they take hospitality seriously and most important very delicious fresh food- but if you are kind of ocd about decor details it will bother you. If you're open to an adventure of food do it! I will be back this weekend it's so good I wanted it all week.

SKz0lnzCeDd1QHdDfajzYQ.text: Worst South Indian food in the charlotte area. Went there for dinner around 6 and the place was almost empty, still the service was way too slow.  We wanted to try a new restaurant in the area. Should've gone to Peacock instead, as we'd planned to.

photos.caption: Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States

QLpqF69Mz60vV1ujwsCoTg.text: No wonder, the rating has/is going down for this restaurant.  My second time to this place was for a to-go pick up and it wasn't a feel good experience, importantly because of their hospitality.  They don't greet you, they keep talking over the phone and show hand gestures to you so you don't know if they ask you to wait, sit somewhere, talk to someone or get out or whatever.   PLEASE greet your customers and be professional.  From other reviews, I understand the taste and quality has gone down a lot.  That's sad!!

yEk9C3r5AM8pLCGlG5GHiA.text: Went for the Sunday lunch buffet. It was really really good! Live dosa station - you can add as many fillings or flavors as you like! I had one with onion and chutney and another with Nutella! Tandoori chicken was really good - had almost an achari taste to them which was fantastic! Lots of good variety and authentic dishes. Super enjoyed the big bowl of papaddams, Limca and Thums Up! It was hard to get the attention of any of the staff members though but considering how busy they were it was understood!

photos.caption: Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States

4MJUSLzPQnoLj8IbEr6z4w.text: There's a pretty good divide here between food quality and service. In short, the food is good and the service is horrible. The menu is huge and making a decision is almost more difficult because of that. But not to worry, I imagine whatever you order will be good.  I went with three other people and when we arrived there were only a few other tables occupied. So we figured we lucked out considering they ought to be new and popular. We waited. Finally got our drinks ordered and waited some more. Finally got our food ordered and waited while they brought out each person's meal over the course of 15-20 minutes. The first meal came out mere minutes after ordering and the last meal came out probably 10 minutes after the one prior. It was as if the first one was made and sitting around on a hotplate waiting to be ordered and the last one had to be made from scratch. It would have been nice to just receive all of them at the same time or at least within a few minutes of each other.  To add to the timing issue in receiving the food, we were disappointed with the responsiveness of servers. As the time went on the restaurant packed in steadily and they had no clue at all what they were doing. Just getting a water refill was near impossible. When you'd finally call a server over they'd either look bothered or confused. As if to say you shouldn't be drinking water so fast. I guess we were talking a lot and getting parched because we had no food to eat?  On the food note, it was as expected from an Indian restaurant. I ordered the Paneer Butter Masala and it meshed perfectly with the rice. On the "Chinese-Indian" fusion portion of the menu (something unique I've never seen at an Indian place before) there were several interesting dishes. My friend ordered the Chinese noodles and for the table we ordered the Shanghai Chilli Paneer which was spicier than expected but still good. It was also confusing because this was on the normal menu but was actually a small dish app. As for the last two people they ordered a couple of dosas. I'm not a fan of dosa myself but they both had no complaints about them or the sauces. Both had plenty of potato inside and 3-4 sauces to dip into. It was the Mysore Delight Dosa that came out almost instantly and became a bit cold by the time the last dish (the other dosa) came out.  In conclusion on this review though, this would not be my first, second or even third choice when I think I want to try Indian again. They do have a lunch buffet however so I would be willing to come back for that. At least then perhaps I won't have to deal as much with the poor service.

trflhSAs4qKLdY0zBK9JWQ.text: Big restaurant with a buffet containing a good variety of Indian dishes. Unfortunately several of them weren't hot, which was concerning. The health inspection sign on the front wall had a score of 90... not good! When I got home, I checked the previous scores and this place had scores of 72 and 75 in 2017!?!  Finally, the previous restaurant in this location had an open kitchen with wrap around windows. Godavari has draped up black fabric along the inside of the entire length of the window, completely blocking any view of the kitchen. It looks so odd, it makes you think they must be hiding something to go to that ugly extreme.  There are at least a half dozen better Indian restaurants between U-city and Concord Mills. Skip this one.

F6omf9zsIM0gQWsNjjbskQ.text: I had buffet, it was very good. Good taste of all the food. I really liked the dessert mango custard and pyasam

WEa7embdevjbcUpxuZP23g.text: One of the best South Indian buffets in the Charlotte area. Also, their dosas are to die for. Love their vegetarian spread.

W8h9kYVnn3sFKXHOExSftw.text: Hopeless at best. Says Truely south indian but haven't had a worse idly ! After returning the idly , the dosa we got as replacement was half burnt ! The quality of food has gone down drastically ...will never come again

19msfywtKXwXOjn6IxsuCg.text: They have good variety in their lunch buffet.. must try mutton curry and paper chicken,  Service- ok Ambience- Not bad Food- great!

viekQ11pBIbmHWvqGmvOHg.text: There is no customer service whatsoever. A lot of food selection but the flavor are just way too strong. And why do you put that jar of water on the table? Saw fly flying around so this place didn't seem to be clean to me. One star for the chicken curry the only thing I really like. Won't go back.

svVRd-oG23m5Fzx7LfpkSg.text: Lunch buffet has a good variety! Biryanis are really good as well as the live dosa counter.   From the a la carts menu everything is really good! The biryani, starters, chicken lollipops, any of the non-veg curries, Hakka noodles and many many more!   I would highly recommend this place as the food is authentic and delicious!! Also, the owner and staff are friendly and helpful.

vpx8A49dN8m_cc9HDYToeQ.text: Had worst buffet experience ever. The restaurant need to ensure that they serve hot and fresh food. Usually, in buffet, one or two dishes are not tasty and that's OK. But today, all the dishes weren't tasty.  They kept on playing old music videos on TV, which was very frustrating. Overall nightmarish experience.  The location is good and the owner should ensure that he keeps a tab on food quality and pleasant ambience, else this restaurant is not going to survive the competition.

UQCIg-umUEURauqz2hMFXw.text: I got the Nallore Chepala Pylusu (Fish Curry) with rice and Garlic Nan. I asked for it Indian Native Spicy and they got it right. I was sweating! This place is perfect to bring a large group or just a couple on date night.  The buffet is like something out of a 5 star Hotel.

wzhw8G2EOFSVl8UP5LWY8g.text: Our go-to place anytime for biryani in Charlotte . The service is good and price is okay.  My pick : Boneless chicken dum biryani , tandoori chicken

Na6X9eb4RG7k49F-HzJmaQ.text: The chandrayaan 2 initiated their voyage to the moon Progress for India yes Before the launch the arm on the explorer grabbed some Indian food for the voyage at Godavari  Much to the rovers dismay eating this crud immediately initiated a gag response  The rocket chocked , spun out of control and crashed into Godavari flattening the restaurant to the ground  The population of Charlotte rejoiced knowing that this stink hole of blatantly bad Indian whatever you call it will was blasted into oblivion  Hopefully never to return   Seriously folks although my storyline is fiction the food ??is not  I'd rather travel lightyears into the darkness of space than to swallow this shit

hu2fnQEVfc5YTWtYv-azDg.text: Solid Indian but I found it not to be as welcoming when I actually dined in at the restaurant. Nothing in particular just I've found many other places that are better with quality of food that suits my palate.  I always spend a considerable amount of money and usually at Indian restaurants I go away feeling like I got the full value. I'm honestly not interested in going back or ordering delivery since I've discovered so many "better" places in this area of Charlotte. Their food isn't bad they just need to work harder at it.

ap2Mq9gXWDxKQF2aC0Qfnw.text: Friday night dinner with one of my girls who had a taste for Indian. The food is authentic. So authentic that the daily specials are in Indian language. Can't read it? Then it's not for you. The staff was very kind and worked as a team. The majority of the clientele was Indian. I ordered samosas and chicken tikka masala. My friend ordered a spicy shrimp and butter chicken.  Everything was served fresh out of the oven or stove, still steaming. The samosas were very aromatic, full of spices. The crust was nice and flaky. I love anything with potato's, so I was in heaven. 10/10. The shrimp were spicy, but not crispy. My chicken tikka masala lacked flavor. The tomato wasn't tomatoey enough. I wanted to add more depth to the flavor. Also, the chicken itself wasn't good quality, and didn't taste fresh. Compared to other Indian restaurants that serve this dish, it didn't stack up. 6/10  I sampled my friend's butter chicken. It was better than my masala, but not anything that wowed me. The butter flavor was prevalent. 6.5/10.  Service was adequate. They were quick, everything was served hot, and they were friendly. Food could improve. Come for the appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Samosas
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rice
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of somosa

MvmsRlTkLdVWbwEl6tNzSw.text: One of the good Indian restaurants in Charlotte. Have tried almost all of their non veg appetiser and they are really good. My most favorite is chicken 65, chilli chicken, chicken 555. Also their chicken and mutton biryani is flavourful. Weekend buffet is an elaborate spread and good in taste. They refill food trays quickly.

mg4Mk1HchaubJVDd7a4uIA.text: My husband really enjoys eating Indian food. He explained this restaurant specializes in South Indian Cuisines. The food was delicious service was pretty good. You can tell by the food, that their is a lot spices and seasonings involved, creating a tasty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish still sizzling.
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dosa with various dipping sauces.
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango Lassi, it is delicious.

VAI03LccunQXnaOOnw65Pw.text: I have been here many times and it's been bad service and horrible food most of the time.we decided to never go here again.If you have an issue with their poor service and tell the owner he will literally just say it was a busy day.buffet is even worse! Food is dried up especially the rice which they call biryani is not even a pulao. Dried up crunchy rice. Dosa is alright on weekends but DO NOT GO for the dosa night special they won't even attend you to take the order.we waited 45min and then got served the wrong order. Over all We hate this place.

IRgFOGW4cZzVzB5ILx5OsA.text: Authentic Indian food. Best restaurant in Charlotte NC. Friendly and helpful servers.

H0Ag04m2F08BBKhIGkD1TA.text: I have been there a several times ; but every time it's been a disappointment! They have lot of options but everything; literally everything is cold ... once i also figured out that one of the chicken starters was stale , I could clearly make out it was reheated n serviced.

9hr8a_NS4asRPIFHtenf7Q.text: I have been to my fair share of Indian Buffets, and while the food was not bad, the lack of variety was something I have never seen in any restaurant. Perhaps I went on a day where they did not expect many customers, but besides the lack of dishes the quantity was running low(almost no chicken in the curry) and the staff was not replacing it until a huge crowd of lunch-goers arrived. Not only did I see many promises of this being the BEST buffet in Charlotte, many people also mentioned a dosa station--which was obviously not there.The only choice for dessert was a few mixed melons(not even gulab jamun!) and for anything else like kulfi(ice cream) it would be extra payment. Overall, there are PLENTY of better Indian Buffets in Charlotte at the same price point, don't waste your time!

G_jeh4Ls6BGB5pzuKZaX2A.text: How they got good license I don't know. Buffet was cold. Nothing was worth to eat. Health department needs to check this place often.

W_myetb-bD9wqI4usOwvRg.text: I was here for a Sunday Buffet. I can give this place for seating and interiors 2/5, but definitely food 4/5. One of the good South Indian restaurants I have been in Charlotte. They had a wide range of dishes including a live dosa counter.  Food was medium spicy with a lot of flavors.  Definitely, this place will have many reviews for their seating and interiors as the floor was quite slippery which may cause anyone to fall.  But food and service is great !

7AqhdIy5IQTsq8aq5t-yNQ.text: I was very much interested to do a take-out at this location, and unfortunately it didn't work out on a Sunday afternoon. The person who spoke over phone informed me that , they cannot do any preparation for take out and it is only buffet that's available.  Will dine in soon next time, when I have a chance.

kQA-H2scGwfo_4QL_-dxUA.text: This place is phenomenal, wished they opened up early, but it's worth the wait. It is in my top 2 restaurants the other being Bonefish Grill. Nice and quiet atmosphere, no distraction from tv's. A perfect place for a date. Prices are just right and there's always enough to take home!

N8HktY_e5-9zrEmdkqDWag.text: Kinda disappointed with this buffet.  Went here because my parents insisted as they had a good previous experience.  The dishes were limited, flavors were bland, and service was lacking.  Our kids didn't eat anything and was still charged the crazy kid price (about $7 a piece) even after talking to the staff about it.  Don't waste your time.  There are better options out there.

8sosSTD0ygLQSby736Gp7Q.text: Sill excellent food and wonderful friendly service! So glad this place made it 2 years!  The food is phenomenal and fabulous presentation with the options they served today!

K4X-bN3CMlv6jOMAgEtqVQ.text: Wouldn't recommend going here for buffet. It is over crowded and food is always cold. They have better service at ala carte.  The variety of food is very authentic, True to its roots - the southern part of India. Flavors are distinctive to every dish and not like the usual- one sauce for all the items on the menu.

Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Godavari - Charlotte, NC, United States

vlUi6Awr8Tr7y5mIUi88Nw.text: If you're near to Godavari and craving for some variety of Indian cuisine, do give it a try. I'm a big fan of their Idly, any paneer curry and biriyanis!

X-iPBHUkl5M3KyGfdVCuKA.text: Went once horrible! The flavors wasn't very good maybe because I'm used to southern Indian cuisine. It smells great but it just didn't come together for me.

nbqLLMWwc-kEXPQqAaYH0g.text: Service was solid, food was great!  During lunch they offer buffet style, with countless options.  What a great spot to try many different Indian dishes all in one sitting.  Just be careful not to take to much... I needed a nap after!  One concern I should point out, their Sanitation Rating was 90% during our visit.   Typically, we will leave if a restaurants score is below 95ish, but it smelled so good we had to give it a try and I'm glad we did.
